**Flame Wave** is a Level 4 [Conjuration](/Conjuration "Conjuration")/[Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic") spell that creates fire around the caster.

[Fire Elementalists](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist") start with this spell in their library.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Flame Wave is a [channeling spell](/Channeling_spell "Channeling spell"). It deals fire damage to adjacent creatures (creatures in a 1-tile radius), then gives the **Wave** status. Subsequent turns can be spent waiting (hitting '.' or tab), which will cast the spell again. This only costs 1 MP, but deals the same damage and increases the radius by 1. This can be done twice, for a total spell cost of 6 MP.

Changing position by any method (whether by moving, [blinking](/Blink "Blink"), teleporting, or being moved by monster attacks like [trample](/Trample "Trample") or [Primal Wave](/Primal_Wave "Primal Wave")) will interrupt Flame Wave.

[Vehumet](/Vehumet "Vehumet")'s range increase will allow this spell to be channeled an additional time, hitting everything within 4 tiles from the caster.

## Strategy

Flame Wave deals decent damage to a whole area, and due to the channeling mechanic, it's reasonably MP-efficient. The main downside is short range, meaning monsters will often be in melee with you. Don't get too greedy; while Flame Wave can hit 8 enemies at once, it also means that you'll be hit by 8 enemies at once.

Despite being a "wave" spell, Flame Wave is effective at corridor combat, too. Compared to other [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic"), it can't directly damage you (unlike [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball"), [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame"), and [Volatile Blastmotes](/Volatile_Blastmotes "Volatile Blastmotes")), and it does more damage per MP than [Scorch](/Scorch "Scorch").

### Tips & Tricks

- An [amulet of the acrobat](/Amulet_of_the_acrobat "Amulet of the acrobat") will improve your [EV](/EV "EV") while you channel the spell, which can help with survivability.
- Flame Wave is strong enough to light [trees](/Tree "Tree") on fire. Using it in forested areas can create massive, deadly infernos, but be careful not to set yourself ablaze in the process.
- Like other fire spells, Flame Wave creates [steam](/Steam "Steam") over any [water](/Water "Water") tile. Using it twice when surrounded by water (e.g. in [Swamp](/Swamp "Swamp") or [Shoals](/Shoals "Shoals")) creates a short-lived, [LOS](/LOS "LOS")-blocking barrier of steam.

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), Flame Wave dealt `2d(4.5+Power/8)` damage.
- Flame Wave was introduced in [0.28](/0.28 "0.28").

Useful Info

Tips & Tricks

  • An amulet of the acrobat will improve your EV while you channel the spell, which can help with survivability.
